com.redhat.rhn.frontend.action.common

Class DateRangePicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.frontend.action.common.DateRangePicker

  • public class DateRangePicker
extends java.lang.Object
    Action setup to handle 2 date picker forms for a start and end date.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DateRangePicker.DatePickerResults
      DatePickerResults class to encapsulate the results of processing the DatePickers in the form.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DateRangePicker

        public DateRangePicker(DynaActionForm formIn,
               HttpServletRequest reqIn,
               java.util.Date defaultStartDateIn,
               java.util.Date defaultEndOffsetIn,
               int yearRangeDirectionIn,
               java.lang.String startKeyIn,
               java.lang.String endKeyIn)
        Construct a new DateRangePicker
        Parameters:
        formIn - to process
        reqIn - to process
        defaultStartDateIn - number of days to offset the start from today
        defaultEndOffsetIn - number of days to offset the end from today
        yearRangeDirectionIn - If you want the year range selector to show years in the future or in the past. See DatePicker.YEAR_RANGE_POSATIVE, and DatePicker.YEAR_RANGE_NEGATIVE
        startKeyIn - the l10n key for the name of the start date
        endKeyIn - the l10n key for the name of the end date

    • Method Detail

      • processDatePickers

        public DateRangePicker.DatePickerResults processDatePickers(boolean isSubmitted,
                                                   boolean justDateRelevant)
        Process the date pickers. This should be called at the top of your execute() method.
        Parameters:
        isSubmitted - if the form was submitted or not
        justDateRelevant - indicates, whether just date is relevant
        Returns:
        DatePickerResults instance that contains the results of processing the form against the DatePickers.
